intro: Richella velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in warm, humid climates. Its growth habit makes it a common weed in agricultural fields and disturbed areas.
